Good Evening All,

My name is Rich Bloch, and I'm the organizer for the Hyperledger Seattle Meetup (HSM). David just mentioned this channel, and since I greatly prefer a chat channel to listserv any day of the week ;), I wanted to jump in and say hello to everyone.

As we just went through a reboot of HSM, I wanted to share with everyone our poll results, as they helped greatly in redefining the tenor and future direction of the meetup.

Poll results are located here (PDF): https://goo.gl/P4W6i6

Looking forward to some great discussions on this channel.
Has joined the channel.

@NikolaSologub -- apologies for the delay in getting back to you.  We had a team meeting last week and I fell behind on email and chat.  Great to see you have a new meetup scheduled.  And for your question about live streaming, I think that's a great question for all the other organizers.  I suggest posting a question on the meetup mailing list -- https://lists.hyperledger.org/mailman/listinfo/hyperledger-meetups

@richbl -- thanks for sharing your poll results.  I think this is full of great information.  Great idea to reach out to people in your group and learn more about what they want so you can make sure they get value out of your events.  Something for all organizers to consider doing.

Hi everyone,
My name is Peter Froystad and I’m from Oslo, Norway. 
I’ve wanted for a long time to start a Hyperledger Meetup group here in Oslo, and I feel like now is the time to get started doing it. I applied today via email to meetup@hyperledger. 
I’ve witnessed the steady growth of the blockchain/DLT community here in the city, and I feel like it has come to the point that there will be enough interest for a dedicated Hyperledger community. I envision that the Hyperledger group would be tailored towards developers and other technical professionals, where we can hold presentations and workshops that help the members to work within the Hyperledger frameworks.

I think it's great that this community have started making some presentation material available, as well as tips and tricks on how to run a successful meetup-group. I think that will be very valuable :)

Cheers,
Peter
@FroystadP -- thanks for reaching out.  it will be great to get your help to bring hyperledger meetings to norway :)

Hi all,  I’m helping organize Hyperledger meetup in Amsterdam on June 28th and inviting everyone to join if you are nearby! 

Come spend a nice evening with fellow blockchain enthusiasts and hear our guest star, Brian Behlendorf, talk about the latest Hyperledger updates. The agenda also includes an intro to Hyperledger Fabric 1.1 with Arnaud Le Hors from IBM, and multi-host deployment of Fabric with Vitaliy Chernov from Altoros. Join us on June 28th, 6 pm, at Circl (ABN AMRO)! 
RSVP: https://www.meetup.com/Hyperledger-Amsterdam/events/251232254/

Also, I’ll appreciate if Hyperledger organizers nearby (Belgium, Germany) could kindly post a note to your groups, just in case some of your members could join us in Amsterdam. Thanks!

Hello everyone

Looking for a resources for introductory level training materials to share with the Working Group Public Sector in our bi weekly conference call. Non technical slides, podcasts, presentations , any suggestions?

@Bobbijn -- we've collected a set of slides for meetup organizers to use that might be helpful for what you're looking for.  take a look at those at: https://wiki.hyperledger.org/community/presentations

We have now launched the new Hyperledger store and we are providing coupons to active meetup groups that can be used to order free swag to give out at your events.

* Active meetup groups (defined as a group that has held at least one meetup in the last 3 months) are eligible to receive the coupons

* Organizers can make a new request for swag each quarter

* The amount of the coupons will be based on the size of the groups ($50 for groups under 100 members, $75 for groups between 101 and 1000, and $100 for groups over 1000)

If you are interested in receiving a coupon, feel free to write me back directly.  If you have any questions about this, please respond to the list since other people may have the same question.

Thanks,
David

Hello everyone, 

My name is Adrian and I am the founder of GST. The reason for my post is to ask for your feedback or comments on a potential collaborative project with Hyperledger and GST.

GST and Hyperledger have been collaborating on finding chapter leaders in countries where Hyperledger Meetup’s don’t exist yet.

We know a big problem for most meetup organizers is finding suitable or relevant speakers for organizing meetups in a consistent basis.

Now, we are planning on using Hyperledger Indy/SOVRIN and an ERC20 token to help solve this problem by:

Creating a list of potential blockchain speakers or ambassadors who’s skills, knowledge or expertise could be certified using Hyperledger Indy/ SOVRIN.
Each speaker will have a potential availability date and country
Use ERC20 token to crowdsource funds for travel/accommodation budget for quality speakers

I would really love to hear your thoughts on this.

Best,

My name is Adrian and I am the founder of GST. The reason for my post is to ask for your feedback or comments on a potential collaborative project with Hyperledger and GST.

GST and Hyperledger have been collaborating on finding chapter leaders in countries where Hyperledger Meetup’s don’t exist yet.

We know a big problem for most meetup organizers is finding suitable or relevant speakers for organizing meetups in a consistent basis.

Now, we are planning on using Hyperledger Indy/SOVRIN and an ERC20 token to help solve this problem by:

Creating a list of potential blockchain speakers or ambassadors who’s skills, knowledge or expertise could be certified using Hyperledger Indy/ SOVRIN.
Each speaker will have a potential availability date and country
Use ERC20 token to crowdsource funds for travel/accommodation budget for quality speakers

I would really love to hear your thoughts on this.

Best,


Adrian

Committed to helping advance the skills of blockchain professionals worldwide, Hyperledger provides hands-on training, professional certifications and fosters the development of free and open-source education resources by the larger Hyperledger community.

https://www.hyperledger.org/resources/training

----------------------------------------------

Hyperledger is an open-source collaborative effort created to advance cross-industry blockchain technologies. It is a global collaboration, hosted by The Linux Foundation, including leaders in finance, banking, Internet of Things, supply chains, manufacturing and Technology.

Why Create Hyperledger?
Not since the Web itself has a technology promised a broader and more fundamental revolution than blockchain technology. A blockchain is a peer-to-peer distributed ledger forged by consensus, combined with a system for “smart contracts” and other assistive technologies. Together these can be used to build a new generation of transactional applications that establishes trust, accountability, and transparency at their core while streamlining business processes and legal constraints.

Think of it as an operating system for marketplaces, data-sharing networks, micro-currencies, and decentralized digital communities. It has the potential to vastly reduce the cost and complexity of getting things done in the real world.

Only an Open Source, collaborative software development approach can ensure the transparency, longevity, interoperability, and support required to bring blockchain technologies forward to mainstream commercial adoption. That is what Hyperledger is about – communities of software developers building blockchain frameworks and platforms.

---------------------------

Thank you, looking forward to collaborative support. 
 
Regards
Prajit Datta

Hey Hyperledger Meetup Organizers! My name is Mike McCoy and I am the new chair of the Healthcare-Special Interest Group. I have been professionally involved in the BC space since 2016 with previous stops at ConsenSys AG and Accenture working in BC strategy, product development, competitive analysis and sales processes. Currently I am the Director of Platform Integration & Technical Partnerships at ConsenSys Health, a spin out of the ConsenSys AG venture, and I am also an Adjunct Professor at Thomas Jefferson University at The Institute of Emerging Health Professions. Local to Philadelphia, I run the Blockchain in Healthcare Today (BHTY) Philadelphia chapter, Blockchain for Social Impact and I am a part of many BC working groups. Looking forward to collaborating with you all on events, working groups and building solutions within the Hyperledger community.

For those interested in our @prasagaofficial progress on the tech side we presented to Hyperledger NYC and Denver Meetups.  Please watch the recording of the premier of ClassFungibleAsset and subclass ClassSmartAsset for enablement of Fungible and Non-Fungible Assets in our GlobalOS, XBOM a First Class Object mode on Hyperledger.  

This is a command line demo which clearly shows how blockchain advances without any smart contracts using DataGrid Token ($DGT) and wrapped ETH ($WETH) as examples.  

Again, everything works as advertised, this release is for our XBOM dev environment and enterprise TestNet for PoC.  The use cases for enterprise, the assets would be pharmaceuticals, spark pugs, bolts, coal, etc in a supply chain.

Pay Attention to the enablement of a Globally UniqueID for every account and every object.

https://youtu.be/X-nlhNQuOAk?t=99
